definition: to weave/to plait/to organize/to group/to arrange/to edit/to compile/to write/to compose/to fabricate

sentences.english: In assembly language, this is handled explicitly by the programmer.

sentences.english: The software is mainly programmed by C-Language, and partly by built-in Assembler-Language.

sentences.english: This assembly language output listing is useful as a debugging aid.

sentences.english: Such code must usually be written in assembly language. Contrast with processor-independent.

sentences.english: Most processor-specific functions must be written in assembly language.

那么为什么不学汇编语言呢？

sentences.english: At least read some tutorials, and write some code.
sentences.chinese: 至少，阅读一些教程，写一些汇编语言代码。

sentences.english: Assembly is a low-level programming language that%27s one step above a computer%27s native machine language.
sentences.chinese: 汇编语言是是计算机硬件之上的底层编程语言。

sentences.english: The assembler language is a kind of symbolic machine language.

sentences.english: For canning know a comprehension hardware work more, I am also self-educated to edit collected materials language in the meantime.

sentences.english: The software part of the cymometer was designed in assembler language.

sentences.english: L0. The assembler language is a kind of computer high-level language.

sentences.english: The compiler supplies the appropriate operand in the assembly language code it generates.
